PromptDefinition.Objective: Analyze an entire frontend repository to create a single, high-level **root knowledge graph**. This graph must map the major architectural "modules" (feature slices and shared directories) and the dependencies *between* them. It should act as an index or table of contents for the more detailed modular graphs. **Do not include details about individual components, functions, or files.**

Input.name: directory_structure
Input.description: The complete directory tree of the repository.

Input.name: modular_graph_files
Input.description: The full XML content of all modular `knowledge-graph.xml` files found within the project (e.g., from `src/pages/Invoices/knowledge-graph.xml`, `src/app/knowledge-graph.xml`, etc.). This is a critical source for identifying inter-module dependencies via their `IS_EXTERNAL_LINK='true'` attributes.

Input.name: codebase_context
Input.description: The full source code of the project, used for high-level annotations and identifying public exports from modules.

HumanUserInstructions.description: This is instructions for human users **ONLY**, it **MUST** be ignored by the Aider and Gemini.

PromptDefinition.HumanUserInstructions:
To get data for the `directory_structure` input, run `tree -a -I 'node_modules|.git|.DS_Store|dist|target*|playwright|tests' > directory_structure.txt`, then /add `directory_structure.txt` file to Aider context. Run `brew install tree` to install the tree command if you don't have it.
To get data for the `modular_graph_files` input, run `find src -name 'knowledge-graph.xml' -exec cat {} + > aggregated_modular_graphs.xml`, then /add `modular_graph_files.txt` file to Aider context.

RuleSet.Section: <Rule description="Each identified module MUST be represented by a single, unique `` tag in the root graph."/>

Rule.description: Module tag names must be globally unique and derived from their directory path.

Attribute.name: PATH
Attribute.description: The original path to the module's root directory (e.g., 'src/pages/Requests').

Element.name: keywords
Element.format: Pipe-separated, high-level keywords describing the module's domain (e.g., 'invoicing|billing|pdf').

Element.name: annotation
Element.format: A concise, one-sentence summary of the module's purpose.

Element.name: PUBLIC_EXPORTS
Element.format: Comma-separated list of key entities the module exposes to the rest of the application (e.g., its root component, key routes, or shared utility functions).

Element.name: CrossLinks
Element.description: This section contains ONLY high-level, inter-module dependencies.

Rule.description: The `FROM` and `TO` attributes MUST be module-level tags (e.g., `Module_Requests_Info`).
Use ONLY the high-level link types defined below.
Derive these links by analyzing the `IS_EXTERNAL_LINK='true'` attributes within the provided `modular_graph_files`.

LinkType.name: FEATURE_USES_SHARED_MODULE
LinkType.description: A feature module (from 'src/pages') uses a shared component or utility (from 'src/components' or 'src/utils').

LinkType.name: MODULE_DEPENDS_ON_API_CLIENT
LinkType.description: A module (typically a saga module) depends on a generated API client for data fetching (from 'src/generated').

LinkType.name: GLOBAL_SAGA_INTERACTION
LinkType.description: A feature module's saga interacts with or is orchestrated by a global saga (from 'src/app/sagas').

LinkType.name: ROUTING_TO_FEATURE
LinkType.description: The main application router directs a specific path to a feature's entry point module.

LinkType.name: FEATURE_DISPATCHES_SHARED_ACTION
LinkType.description: A feature module dispatches a global or dictionary action (e.g., from `src/app/actions` or `src/dictionaries/actions`).

Section.name: Workflow for AI
Section.Instruction: Scan the `directory_structure` and identify all major modules (each directory in `src/pages`, plus `src/app`, `src/components`, `src/dictionaries`, `src/generated`).
For each module, create its corresponding `` tag.
For each module, analyze its `routes.tsx` or top-level `index.ts` to determine its `PUBLIC_EXPORTS`.

Scan all provided `modular_graph_files`. For every `` you find, create a corresponding high-level `` in the root graph's `` section. Map the specific link type to the appropriate `HIGH_LEVEL_LINK_TYPE`.

PromptDefinition.Example:
<KnowledgeGraph> <MySky_AR_Frontend_v1_Info VERSION="1.0.0"> <keywords>accounts_receivable:10|invoicing:9|frontend:9|react:8|redux:8</keywords> <annotation>Root-level knowledge graph for the Accounts Receivable microfrontend, outlining its major modules and their interactions.</annotation>
<Module_App_Info TYPE="ARCHITECTURAL_MODULE" PATH="src/app"> <keywords>global|core|app_setup|root_state</keywords> <annotation>Handles core application logic, global state, routing, and API initialization.</annotation> <PUBLIC_EXPORTS>App, rootReducer, rootSaga, initAPI</PUBLIC_EXPORTS> </Module_App_Info>
<Module_Components_Info TYPE="ARCHITECTURAL_MODULE" PATH="src/components"> <keywords>shared_ui|reusable|controls|layout</keywords> <annotation>Library of shared, reusable React components used across all features.</annotation> <PUBLIC_EXPORTS>FilterEditor, NoDataContainer, MoreButton, RootTabs</PUBLIC_EXPORTS> </Module_Components_Info>
<Module_Invoices_Info TYPE="ARCHITECTURAL_MODULE" PATH="src/pages/Invoices"> <keywords>invoices|billing|pdf_generation|crud</keywords> <annotation>The primary feature for creating, viewing, editing, and managing invoices.</annotation> <PUBLIC_EXPORTS>InvoicesRoot, INVOICES_ROUTE</PUBLIC_EXPORTS> </Module_Invoices_Info>
<Module_Generated_Info TYPE="ARCHITECTURAL_MODULE" PATH="src/generated"> <keywords>api_clients|typescript_types|openapi</keywords> <annotation>Auto-generated API clients and TypeScript types from backend OpenAPI specifications.</annotation> </Module_Generated_Info>
<CrossLinks> <Link FROM="Module_Invoices_Info" TO="Module_Components_Info" TYPE="FEATURE_USES_SHARED_MODULE" RELEVANCE="9" DESCRIPTION="The Invoices feature uses shared components like FilterEditor and NoDataContainer." /> <Link FROM="Module_Invoices_Info" TO="Module_Generated_Info" TYPE="MODULE_DEPENDS_ON_API_CLIENT" RELEVANCE="10" DESCRIPTION="Invoice sagas depend on the 'accountsReceivable' and 'ledger' API clients." /> <Link FROM="Module_App_Info" TO="Module_Invoices_Info" TYPE="ROUTING_TO_FEATURE" RELEVANCE="10" DESCRIPTION="The root router delegates all '/invoices' paths to the Invoices module." /> </CrossLinks> </MySky_AR_Frontend_v1_Info> </KnowledgeGraph>
